content: skyscrapers swim skyscrapers swim by mojca čepič alias maramacko figure 1 a b c a socks on adult s feet b side view on blockers c note the motif is equal on the outer side of both socks but it continues from one sock to another this pattern combines a few techniques stranded ladderback jacquard manipulating stripes and steeking the stranded part will give the impressions of city where skyscrapers stand with their feet close to the sea and manipulated stripes mimic the sea waves the sea and the background of the skyscrapers are knit in gradient or self- striping yarn stripes below skyscrapers are manipulated a little to give an impression of waves and steeking is necessary to obtain the same multicolour background for skyscrapers and the sea without worrying about mismatched gradients or stripes from random coloured self-striping yarn leftovers can also be used for background the colour sequence is exactly the sam e a fsor both socks thanks to the steek the steek solves several problems one knows that knitting socks with gradien t or self-striping yarn almost never results in exactly the same colour sequence for both socks positions of stripes are almost never the same because often the gauge varies a little from one day to another and in some cases the gradient yarn does not have a repeating sequence at all the latter makes it impossible to finish with two matching socks if they are knitted separately all such problems are solved by a steek both socks are knit at the same time both in one round with the same yarn they are bound together as siamese twins they are separated in the final stage of knitting during the sewing rounds are adjusted so that the same colour continues around the sdoicffki c eullitmyi lneavteinl g i jnotgesr ams ewdeilal t e to advanced the legs are stranded as some floats are very long ladderback jacquard lbj is strongly advised to maintain elasticity although the stranded pattern is not repetitive after the highest skyscrapers are positioned it becomes very logical and quite appropriate for learning lbj wavesa asr we eslilm asple increases decreases and purls there are no novelties in the cuff heels or toes nevertheless the whole construction requires a certain level of spatial perception familiarity withbr tihefely steek and its sewn reinforcements either by hand or by sewing machine in this pattern i focus on machine support stitches but stabilization by hand is also discussed to help with visualizing the structure while knitting the model to cut and fold is included at the end of the pattern 1
